intro: Vulpiella stipoides, commonly known as the foxglove grass, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically violet or purple in color, arranged in dense spikes. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal or semi-arid regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely known outside of its native habitat.
